review: In theory I loved it, but in practice it didn't work for me at all. I like the remote better than the one that comes with Roku, because I like the "ok/go" button in the center of the directional pad. The menu is easy to navigate, the picture is great, setup was easy... it was perfect. Unfortunately, the remote wouldn't work from more than three feet away. My HDMI plugs are in the center, back of the TV, and even with the little extender that comes with the stick I guess the EM interference was too great. I had to stand near the TV, with my arm out to the side, to get the remote to respond.So, yes, I could have bought an HDMI extender, but I made the aesthetic choice not to go with the "dongle hanging down" look. I'm considering the non-stick version of Amazon Fire, pending my experience with the Roku 3.
